document_metadata.title: 原文无此信息
institutions: School of Computer Science, Beijing University of Posts and Telecommunications, Beijing, China

base_methods.evidence_text: K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) and Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) are two classification methods used in collaborative filtering.
K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN) and Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) are two classification methods used in collaborative filtering.
We apply logistic regression to build a classifier using the generated feature vectors.

compared_methods.comparison_result: The combined classifier outperforms single classifiers.
compared_methods.evidence_text: The combined classifier outperforms single classifiers.

datasets_used.dataset_description: student interaction logs from intelligent tutoring systems
datasets_used.evidence_text: Participants were provided with student interaction logs from intelligent tutoring systems, with two datasets: algebra 2008-2009 and bridge to algebra 2008-2009.

datasets_used.dataset_description: student interaction logs from intelligent tutoring systems
datasets_used.evidence_text: Participants were provided with student interaction logs from intelligent tutoring systems, with two datasets: algebra 2008-2009 and bridge to algebra 2008-2009.

quantitative_results.evidence_text: The combined classifier achieves an RMSE of 0.2820 on Algebra 2008-2009 dataset.
KNN: RMSE values on Algebra 2008-2009 dataset is 0.3257 with meta-parameters K β.
SVD: RMSE values on Algebra 2008-2009 dataset is 0.446277 with meta-parameters N, η, λ.
Logistic Regression: RMSE on Algebra 2008-2009 dataset is 0.2895.

stated_advantages: The combined classifier outperforms single classifiers.
Logistic regression shows the best performance due to its exploitation of detailed feature vectors.
